abstract: The outcry over Google’s social networking feature sheds light on the challenges all technology companies must face when it comes to thinking about privacy, says one researcher.
snippet: The outcry over Google’s social networking feature sheds light on the challenges all technology companies must face when it comes to thinking about privacy, says one researcher.
lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — When Google introduced a new social networking feature called Buzz last month, it hoped that users would leap at the chance to share content with the people they e-mailed with most often. But instead, the company found itself facing a firestorm of angry users and awash in criticism from privacy advocates and bloggers.

headline.main: One Analysis of the Google Buzz Mess
